Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110424 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.10 ThunderBrowse/3.3.5

The download manager gives a file size during downloads (x of y MB) but gives no indication of the download not completing. The particular circumstances in which I'm seeing this is in downloading attachments to an RSS feed. In my case, I'm unable to set more than two attachments downloading simultaneously without they ALL abort, but I'm prepared to believe this is due to my crappy satellite ISP. However, the download manager really ought to give an indication that this has happened, rather than the user has to make a note of expected file sizes and then check the final value. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. You need a download of an attachment to abort. 
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
If a download aborts, then the file size is just shown as the amount that was successfully downloaded before the abort happened. There is no indication that the expected download was truncated. 

Expected Results:  
There should be some means of flagging the fact that the download did not run to completion - even if it's something as simple as making the size entry in the download manager "x MB of y MB", as it is during the actual downloading. 

As above, I am perfectly willing to believe that these aborts are *caused* by my being a captive customer of HughesNet's satellite service. I am *not* complaining about the aborts happening, I'm complaining about Thunderbird's failure to give any indication that they have happened. The program already has the information needed, one possible fix should be something as simple as amending a label in the download manager so that the expected filesize which is displayed during the download process is still visible when the download has completed. It would be great if Thunderbird could automatically retry, or even just put a retry button there for the user to initiate the retry, but I will happily settle for just having some way to know that the problem has occurred without my having to make a separate note of file sizes and compare the final figures with that separate note.

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Wayne Mery (:wsmwk) from comment #6)
> Reporter do you still see this problem when using recent version of
> Thunderbird?

I don't know without a little work, as I've switched to Debian since I logged this bug, and that means Iceweasel, which is based on Firefox 3.x. I can no doubt install a later "genuine" Firefox, but I prefer not to go outside the repositories if I have a choice. The aborts do *NOT* occur with Iceweasel, interestingly enough, I've had much more than two downloads going at a time and have not seen it happen. 

It should be simple enough for you to determine whether the main problem still exists, though. Simply do a download, and *once it's completed*, check whether the details show 'X MB of Y MB'. That (IMO) was the main part of the problem, as I noted in comment 5. I can easily believe that the aborts were due to my crappy satellite connection, it's that failure of Firefox to indicate that (substantially) less data was downloaded than was expected which I think is unquestionably a bug. If no-one has worked on it, then the bug will still be there, write(*) statements don't add additional terms spontaneously. :) 

(*) Sorry for the Pascal terminology, me no speak 'C'.

I can only repeat the comments I made a couple of years ago. I still see the problem in Debian's IceDove (Thunderbird) and IceWeasel(Firefox) but they're both still lagging in versions, and are both based on V17.x.y (17.0.10 if they've kept the numbering intact). 

As regards whether it's still in V24, rather than me have to risk buggering up my system with any library mismatches by downloading and installing V24, all that you need is for someone who has V24 to do a single download, and see whether the download shows X MB of Y MB  **once the download has completed**. 

That's all I'm asking for. While the file is downloading, Thunderbird and Firefox show "X MB of Y MB", but once the download has completed or aborted, you just get "X MB". Either keep it as "X MB of Y MB" **when the download has completed** or add some other kind of flag if the download stops short. 

As it is, all you can do is to write down file sizes of each download and then check them after the download has finished, which is a PITA. 

If you really needd me to tell you whether the problem is still there, ask again and I'll post a request on the mailing lists and ask someone with V24 to do a download.
